intro: Ricotia cretica, commonly known as Cretan ricotia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically pale yellow or greenish in color. Its leaves are trifoliate, meaning they consist of three leaflets, and it produces small, pod-like fruits. Ricotia cretica is often found in rocky or coastal areas, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
